inn1.comm: straight and full, clipped into the leg side and a huge cheer as the batsmen scurry through for a single
slightly shorter but great line, Chanderpaul, sporting the familiar black strips under his eyes, goes back and gets right into line
Chanderpaul back again, the ball hit him on the thigh and trickled an inch past the leg stump
slanted across the left hander and left alone
another big cheer as Gul fires one down the leg side, Chanderpaul shimmies inside the line and it's the first wide of the tournament
good line, starting straight and swinging across Chanderpaul who leaves it alone
Chanderpaul back and angles the ball down to third man, all in control to keep the strike
inswinger, a tad too full, and a controlled steer to third man
left alone by Gayle ...it started on the same line as the first ball but did not swing at all
a rather loose drive aimed through the covers, off the inside edge to midwicket
Gayle plays inside the line of the ball which was a foot outside the off stump
worked down to third man, all along the ground
Naved-ul-Hasan drifts to leg and Chanderpaul flicks him to backward square leg
chopped down to third man - possibly a little to close to him to play that shot with comfort - but while it was uppish it was quite safe

Gayle on his way! Umar Gul banged one in a little short, the ball left Gayle off the seam, he nibbled at it and Kamran Akmal took a big step to his left to hold a catch at stomach height. That's an identical dismissal to the way Gayle fell in the warm-up match against India last week.

dropped Younis Khan at second slip got both hands to a ball that was travelling to his right but he could only parry it. It was a poor shot from Sarwan - he slashed hard but with no foot movement -  and West Indies have been let off the hook
turned wide of mid-on but hit too hard to allow the single
a no-ball from Gul ... he's fired up and put in the extra effort with that one
Chanderpaul back and across, blocked into the covers
Gul again short of a length and Chanderpaul happy to push that defensively into the covers. A good over from Gul that could have been even better
sweet and deft leg glance, moved inside the line and clipped wide of the keeper. Not a hint of movement
another no-ball - and a loud grunt from the bowler
against Sarwan played a loose shot, the ball cut back between bat and pad and Akmal took it will as it headed down the leg side
short and Sarwan pulls his bat well out of danger
seamed from outside off and got even wider. Sarwan aimed a wild slash at the ball, narrowly missing the edge, and Bowden ignores a stare which hinted that it might have been a wide
wide and short, Sarwan hammered that through the covers. It was a good a shot as the previous one was horrible
shortish and Sarwan, with eight off the over, is happy to leave that alone
angled across Chanderpaul who doesn't want to know and leaves it well alone
full, through a half-hearted shot and a stifled appeal but the ball pitched outside the leg stump
Kaneria earns a hard stare from his captain and rightly so. Chanderpaul pushed to short extra cover, Kaneria picked it up and hurled it about six feet over a bemused Akmal's head for four overthrows
pushed into the off side. Inzamam is still fuming and Kaneria looks as if he wants to be anywhere but out in the middle
another defensive jab into the covers
Chanderpaul back and into line. A good over spoiled by Kaneria's moment of madness
punched off the back foot to cover, no pace on the ball and so no run
a half-hearted push to one outside off stump, but it wouldn't have carried even if it had found the edge
Sarwan back in his crease and pushed once more into the covers. His two fours have been good, but he looks a little out of sorts otherwise
driven into the ground, it bounces over the bowler but straight to mid-off
steered off his legs to deepish midwicket ... he used the pace of the ball well
again Naved-ul-Hasan drifts to the leg side, and Chanderpaul easily works the ball into space
lovely delivery from Gul, slanted across Chanderpaul who makes a late decision to leave it. He has bowled well so far and deserves his success ...
Chanderpaul misses as he shapes to flick through the leg side and the ball thuds into his pads. Never a suggestion of an appeal ...
driven on the half volley to Kaneria at mid-off ... Kaneria opts not to try anything heroic and is happy just to polish the ball and carefully return it to Gul
Chanderpaul leaves another one angled across him
pushed firmly to the right of Kaneria at mid-off, no danger of a run-out even had he picked the ball up cleanly, which he didn't
not really that short but Sarwan pounced on the ball quickly, stepping back and flicking the ball to the boundary at backward square leg
a loose drive outside off stump, missed and through to Akmal
Chanderpaul back and drops the ball into the leg side but the fielders sweep in to prevent thoughts of a run
turned to backward square leg. Naved-ul-Hasan is struggling to find a consistent  line, especially to Chanderpaul
Sarwan steps back and watches the ball pass
same line and for a moment Sarwan seemed poised to pull that, but in the end he shouldered arms
fuller and Sarwan jabs down to block
Chanderpaul back and blocks
driven firmly to the hapless Kaneria and he earns a few brownie points by stopping it
pushed into the covers and three men run in to field
another good ball, short of a length and on off stump, forcing Chanderpaul to step back and defend
Chanderpaul turned square and misses the ball, a big shout from Akmal but it pitched outside leg stump and Simon Taufel not in the least interested
again on the spot and Chanderpaul has to settle for blocking it
poor ball, short and wide, and Sarwan steps across and hammers that off the back foot through the covers
pushed firmly into the covers

full and wide, Sarwan throws the kitchen sink at the ball and slaps it over short extra cover. Not a chance of that being anything other than a four and Inzamam once more looks less than amused even by his taciturn standards
prodded to cover
through Sarwan and an enthusiastic appeal for leg-before from the bowler but Bowden shakes his head.  Always too high
again cracked through the covers, but this one is not timed as well and it is retrieved a few yards inside the rope
pushed firmly into the cover
tickled round to fine leg for an easy single
ooh! Loving that one from Gul, down the channel, straight and true, and the batsman moves back to try to give himself room to cut, there was no room, and he slashes over the ball
nips back in off a length outside off with a hint of zing and Gul's really in his rhythm here
short ball, pitches outside off and wobbles around in the air there. Sarwan plays and misses yet again, once more trying to slash a cut at that, and just failing to find the edge
goes wider this time and that's well left
works that with soft hands straight to the man at midwicket and there's not even a hint of a single on
good delivery now from Rao, moving away from the lefthander's outside edge - Chanderpaul played at that one
worked down off the back foot into the covers
pushed up there, just outside off, and Chanderpaul plays it down well, off the back foot and taking the pace right off as he steers it into gully
rushes that one down the channel and that's easily left. This is some good bowling by the Pakistan pair - keep that up and the pressure will soon be building
on the money again, another dot, and another maiden in fact
left alone outside off
shot! We liked that one, a full stride into the ball, just leans into it and pierces the slender gap - about a metre or so between fielders - as that races through point
straight to the man just behind point this time and the crowd get excited as they think it's consecutive fours, but pull out of their cheer as the ball's snapped up
turned off the toes in front of square - they look for a second, and it's not on, but Akmal muffs the return throw. No matter
left alone outside off
bends away from the lefthander who quickly shoulders arms - and that's a good decision
dropped down off the back foot into short cover where there's some alert work from the fielder, warning against taking a run
Iftikhar picks up the ball as it's straight-batted into the ground and back to him and shapes to shy it at the stumps, but realises the batsman's back in his crease
straight and that's worked into the midwicket region with soft hands

short, a touch wide, and that's well cut away behind point off the back foot with a flourish. A good shot is matched by some sliding sharp work at a very deep third man, so deep he's nearly a fourth man
Kaneria runs around on the third man boundary and wings it back in
straighter, but the batsman does well to make room to cut that away down to third man and they run through quickly
worked off the back foot into cover
managed to get his pad out of the way, account for the swing, and that's worked behind square and that's the fifty up
driven through cover where Shoaib Malik does the honours
left alone outside off this time
straighter and that's quickly latched on to in front of point
worked down to third man
driven to mid-off where it's picked up easily
oh! Beauty squares him up a treat outside off - and Sarwan manages just about to leave that one
good response from Sarwan, creaming that wide of mid-on to bring up the fifty partnership from 81 balls for this pair. Good stuff - this is the confidence they needed
leading edge looking to turn it into the on-side, but the ball falls low into cover
zinged in, up there outside off, and there's an attempted drive through cover but the batsman doesn't quite get hold of it
another good delivery, right up there on the money, and the batsman can only defend that one
left alone outside off
played down patiently off the back foot into cover
bends that one in from outside off and Chanderpaul nurdles that one into the covers
bowled at 83mph, and that's driven uppishly in front of point, there's no sniff of a catch, though, yet there is a tidy bit of work, the fielder diving forward to snap the ball up
steps into that cover drive, where Inzy does the job at cover (obviously enough)
left alone
driven to cover
if you're going to flash, then it may as well be hard, and a thick edge flies low to third man
straight and that's fended down off the back foot in front of him

worked down off the back foot, and they choose to hurry a quick single to cover - it was a big risk, but it paid off for the batsmen this time. Iftikhar did well to run round, turn and shy, even though he missed
over the wicket, and that's nicely bowled across the lefthander, worked to cover
top stuff again and he nearly has his man, Chanderpaul flashing a straight blade at that one on the back foot, before withdrawing from the shot at the last minute
defended forward into the covers
oh dear, terrible shot to one which kept low and came back. Sarwan aims an awkward jab at that one which has a hint of reverse swing but manages not to get bat on it, luckily enough for him
up there and that's defended forward. Naved looks much more comfortable at this end

a bit of loop ducks in at the batsman outside off, he does well to drive it to mid-on and the batsmen chance the single, just getting there in time. Overstepped no-ball, there, and West Indies will take all runs coming their way right now
driven to cover this time
short ball, defended down off the back foot into cover

over the wicket and pushes that one slightly away from the lefthander who chops down a thick bottom edge which crashes into the ground, but behind, and indeed wide of, the sticks. Akmal pouches the through-ball

that's a good ball, straight again, and Sarwan brings his bat down late on that, looking to drive it straight - a thick edge flies safe, and low, but it's not where he wanted to place the ball. Nevertheless they take the single

and Iftikhar strikes! great delivery, surprises Chanderpaul with the bounce, at chest height. The batsman jumps back, opens the face and feels outside the off stump - sure enough he connects with the ball, steering it straight into Akmal's open gloves, who did well with a dive to his left. Iftikhar gets his reward for some consistently straight bowling
on the button but he looks to get off the mark straight away with a push into the covers - it's a good diving save, though
steps on to his back foot to fend that down in front of him
off the mark at last with a quick single
runs that one down to third man
good start, turned past a lunge outside off stump
squirted to backward point. Kaneria right on the button
on the spot, pushed defensively into the off side
another one right where it matters, Samuels can do no more than cautiously defend
good, tight bowling once more
really good over to open up, all six balls forcing the batsman to play and also putting doubt in his mind with one that really ripped past the outside edge
fractionally outside off stump and right through a hesitant defensive jab
much the same area but this time Sarwan is confident enough that it will hold its line to leave it
pushed into the covers for a spot of tip-and-run, good communication and never any danger of a run-out once both batsmen had committed
Samuels seemed to think about smacking that straight but checked and blocked. The crowd are a little restless
too wide and slashed to the man on the backward point boundary for a single, provoking a burst of cheers and horns from the crowd

worked to the right of mid-on for an easy single even through the fielder picked up and threw down the stumps at the striker's end. The batsman must have been well home as there wasn't even a call for the third umpire
Sarwan back and cuts to point
deft glide fine on the off, Mohammad Hafeez dives all over the ball and makes a real mess of it as the ball trundles on its merry way to the rope
pushed into the off side
wide, spun and left alone
driven up the ground to long-off for a comfortable single
flighted and full, the drive was not quite timed and it squirmed into the covers rather than straighter, which was the intention
the balls beats a semi-defensive prod, a loud appeal - in fact two appeals - but it was always heading down the leg side as he bowled it from so wide of the crease
too much width, slashed to backward point and a great diving stop to his right deservedly gets a warm response from the crowd
fuller length driven back to the bowler
seamed back from short of a length, Sarwan wafts and looks all at sea with a really insipid shot

Sarwan falls one short of his fifty, caught at first slip off the outside edge as he played a loose drive to a ball pitched up to him. It has been a real curate's egg of an innings, and while Younis Khan will be happy to have held the chance, it should be remembered that he put Sarwan down off the first ball he faced
Lara pushed forward and blocks
defensive prod into the covers
angled off the face to backward point
flighted a bit more, Samuels back and defends into the leg side
pushed away with no attempt to attack
a bit too short and slightly outside off stump, swatted to cover
pushed to Inzamam at extra cover who pounces like a rather slow middle-aged accountant to prevent the one
defended off the back foot and Lara rehearses the shot, scything through fresh air
straight and up there and Lara comes forward with a nimble stride to kill the threat with a forward defence
well judged, left even though it was only a matter of inches outside the off stump
Lara leaves and then twists his hips towards the leg side as the ball passes
identical delivery ... Lara is leaving these well alone as he gets his eye in
Lara lays into that one with a thumping drive, but Hafeez at extra cover leaps to his left to stop a certain four
blocked ... 20 balls since the last run
Samuels slips as he steps back and thumps that to the man sweeping on the off si8de
Lara drives firmly to extra cover
down the leg side, Lara shapes to sweep and misses, and both bowler and keeper go up to appeal, although it is not clear what for. Taufel calls a wide
defensive push loops high on the off side, and shouts of catch it are all rather unnecessary
once more speared down the left side. Kaneria seems worried about giving him too much width on the off side
up in the blockhole, kept out but no more
a loud double-appeal from Kaneria as Lara is hit on the pads, but more chance of Percy Sonn ordering a soft drink than that one being given
Samuels frees his arms and thumps the ball high over the bowler's head. It was in the slot and it was really smacked
and again, once more hit on the up, this time over extra cover and it races to the extra-cover rope. Two half volleys, ten runs
short and Samuels swivels to pull the ball to long leg
Lara back and up on his toes, he runs the ball to cover where it is well fielded
Lara pushes the ball to mid-on and is off the mark - to a big cheer - after 13 balls
short and heaved through midwicket - the least attractive shot of the over, but effective
full, crisply clipped to long-on
driven hard to the sweeper
class, no other word for that. Lara used the pace of the ball and ran the ball fine off the face of the bat through first slip
up in the blockhole, driven back to the bowler
Lara back and read the wrong 'un well, was about to sweep when he picked it and he quickly switched to a defensive push
another good ball keeps Lara quiet, but the last two overs have belonged to the hosts
inside edge squirts down to long leg
Lara turns the ball to backward point
pushed through at 55mph, Lara watchfully runs that once more to backward point
pushed through, no real flight, and Lara punches it to mid-on
patted back to the bowler
Lara steers it to backward point and looks for the single, Samuels is having none of it and just as well as it was well picked up
straight - and true - drive made to look very easy; struck cleanly against the spin and you've got to love that one
Samuels taking Kaneria on, hitting it right back to him, bump ball, and the bowler tidies that one up
same ball and Kaneria shies at the striker's end this time
that's just beasted high and far over long-on, down the track and elegantly whipped away, we liked that one, too

ah, Samuels's aggression getting the better of him and he was nearly a gonner then, rushing a drive, but getting an edge which runs away through third man. The batsman was out of his crease - he could have been stumped
a huge, but lone, appeal from Akmal for a stumping - sharp work from the keeper but Samuels's foot was grounded
driven to cover for an easy single and a chance for a quick breather after last over's excitement
curls that one in on off stump and that's dealt with tidily
worked off the toes, delicately, to square leg for an easy single
bends in from outside off and that's worked to mid-on for a languid run
goes to forward defend and that pops up off the bat but not dangerously
a quick strike-stealing single - very quick in fact - and that's the over
come forward looking for the on-drive, adjusts his shot when he realises it's closer to him than expected, and plays a tidy defence
down on one knee and sweeps that along the ground out to the man on the square boundary
cut down behind point
cut behind point again, this time for a single
worked into the cover and will they run? "No!"
driven in front of point
swept behind square and his top hand comes off the bat with the shot
eased out to the point boundary and that's a quick single
"Yes!" they cry, charging up the pitch - and back again - after the ball's caressed to cover
"Owzaaat?" wonder both keeper and bowler, but that would have clipped outside leg stump and the benefit is, rightly, with the batsman
driven to cover for a quick single
placed on a good length and Samuels moves on to his back foot, trying to work that through mid-off, but doesn't have enough room to get a firm strike on the ball and it plops forward
Lara defends well, there, right over the ball and that's a good example for any young student of the game watching, er, imagining
pops up - but harmlessly in the end - into the covers and that's a quick single
defended on the front foot
Lara at his best! Comes down to meet that one and sends it flying over mid-off for a straight, flat six. Superb eye, superb hands. Superb, really
defended this time
drops that down a touch wide, Lara impishly scamps backwards to make room to cut that behind point and it races away
driven to cover
pitches on leg, turns in a touch and Samuels gets his wrists over it
worked to midwicket, and there's a good slide-and-throw
driven through cover this time
worked off the back foot through cover and that's a quick single
round the wicket, pushed up there, and helped into a very short midwicket
places that one short and on off, and that's driven to cover
played round fine off his legs
driven to mid-off
worked into midwicket
forward defended
stands tall and whips that off his legs forward through mid-on
worked into midwicket
helped out to point
round the wicket and places that outside off - the batsman comes forward, tempted, but defends over the ball in the end
lovely shot, simple, graceful - Lara gets down on one knee (good man) and sweeps that with a sweet dink just short of the boundary
driven to cover this time
"Catch it" is the very vain shout as that one leaps aerially, but into space, and the batsmen scramble a run
defended
driven to mid-on
ooh, ooh. Interesting. Malik annoyed that Akmal failed to pouch that one, dropping the fine edge. Akmal's glovework leaving much to be desired as is, sadly, often the case
Lara immediately makes the bowler pay, scrambling a single through mid-on to bring up Windies' 150
now that's a cracker, Samuels getting over the ball and lashing a cut to point: unfortunately for him he smacked it straight to a fielder
waits for that and turns it just behind square
pitched outside off, attempted sweep
driven out square to the man on the point boundary
played forward
ooh, risky, Lara coming forward to prod at that one and the ball pops up off the face into short midwicket
well swept behind square but Yousuf does a tidy job inside the rope
driven to mid-off
Samuels brings up his fifty in emphatic manner, one step down the track and  lofting the ball high into the stands behind the bowler
Samuels shapes to come and meet this one but gets a bit tangled
again not quite timed but this time he finds space in the off
Lara takes a big stride and looks to guide the ball fine on the off side, but it goes straight to the fielder
paddled fine on the leg side, evading the man on the 45 and the pace of the delivery does the rest
wristy flick to deep midwicket
Lara looks to sweep from outside the off stump and Akmal holds a thin edge. Lara doesn't wait for the decision, sharply turning and heading off as Akmal, who has had another mixed day, celebrates
Bravo punches the ball into the leg side and is off the mark straight away
punched to Inzamam at extra cover
clipped right to midwicket

short, ripped across the batsman and well taken down the leg side by Akmal who launches into a shrieking appeal for the catch behind., Nothing doing from Bowden, although he doesn't signal the  wide so acknowledging that it hit something on its way through
worked past a diving midwicket for two into the deep
patted into the leg side off the back foot
Bravo steps back to cut and misses, slipping slightly as he plays the shot
Bravo finds the gap this time for an easy one
clipped firmly to midwicket, slight drama as Bravo came quite a way looking for the single and had to scamper back
poor ball, down the leg side and helped on its way

confusion, the ball is played into the covers, Bravo again came too far and had to dive full length as the ball was fired in ... but as it was Shoaib Malik dropped the ball and shattered the stumps with his empty hands
Bravo looks to pull and misses
turned into the leg side but right to a man
pushed into the off side to give Samuels the strike, which is what West Indies really need
an oh-so-delicate shot, running the ball fine through where first slip would have been, sublime touch
into the leg side but no run as midwicket quickly onto it

Samuels tried to give himself room to smack it over long-on but didn't connect as he intended and the ball went right down the throat of Shoaib Malik. A tame end to an entertaining innings, and now West Indies will struggle to press on as they needed to in these final overs
premeditated paddle into the leg side, quite safe and backward square leg fields
driven into the off side,. poor calling and a rather hectic scramble ensues as Ramdin has to hurry to make safety
Ramdin misses an attempted cut
punched to extra cover, Ramdin again really struggles to find any gap

Ramdin is well stumped by Akmal. He lurched forward, missed the ball and while his foot was behind the line, he overbalanced momentarily and it was in the air as the bails came off. He seemed to know that he was done for even before the third umpire's decision, and the innings is coming off the rails
single into the leg side ...but they need boundaries and they need them straight away
Smith back and flicks to leg but the fielders are all in to stop singles
missed an attempted drive, off the pads into the off side
shapes to sweep, misses and a massive shout for leg-before  is turned down
too full and slog-swept high over midwicket, that was six all the way
turned wide of midwicket and great running ensures two where most players would have settled for a single ..even so, they were struggling had Akmal not dropped the return
Smith finds another gap on the off. Good running and a productive over. Four more of those and West Indies will have salvaged something from this
pitches outside off and that's easily cut away behind point, the batsman making a room to dab that down - the man at gully got a hand on it
full toss, low and in line with off - the batsman drives it out to mid-off
wide of mid-off and that's a clean, well-driven four through cover to bring up the 200
windy whoosh to one which sailed down the off channel - he was looking to put that through midwicket but completely missed it
good ball, short and cramped the batsman who did well to squeeze that off his chest over the slips, a deliberate shot and good improvisation
tip and run into the off side, another productive over
turned from off stump into the leg side
good slower ball (111kph/69mph) up in the blockhole and dug out but no more
another slower ball but too straight and helped on its way fine on the leg side. Not a good delivery as he lost his line
superb yorker, dug out with a loss of dignity but quite effectively and a run to add to the bowler's sense of being hard done by
horrible ... leg-side full toss hammered to the rope
it continues to get worse for the bowler as yet another slower ball is swatted hit into the stands over cow corner, six all the way and even were there a longer boundary. Poor over
turned to midwicket, scrambled run although even had the shy at the stumps hit Bravo would have been home
Smith attempted to hammer the ball to leg but it was wider than he thought and he ended up hitting it into the heavens off the toe of the bat. Inzamam at extra cover made no mistake with the catch
steered to backward point
yorker-length, driven hard back to the bowler who fields and shapes to throw down the stumps, but thinks better of it
slower ball (74mph) worked into the leg side
leg-side delivery, Akmal takes the ball as the batsmen set off for a single, but his throw is dire and what could have been trouble is anything but
Taylor again finds space and this time no dramatics as the pair run the single

yorker, dug out back to the bowler, the batsmen immediately set off for the single but Iftikhar Anjum gathered, turned and threw down the stumps at the bowler's end. Taylor in effect sacrificed himself to get Bravo onto strike
full toss, Bravo leans back and sends that rasping through extra cover. Good shot but not a sensible delivery

Bravo is undone by the slower ball, coming to the pitch of it but completing his stroke too early - with his bottom hand slipping off the handle as he played it - and Naved-ul-Hasan at third man takes the catch with no alarms
good inswinging yorker, jammed out into the leg side by Powell. Not much more he could have done there
dribbled into the leg side, picked up by midwicket and while the shy would have found Collymore short at the bowler's end, it was not worth the overthrow which resulted
what a finale! Collymore swatted that fullish delivery many a mile over the head of long-on to send the crowd into raptures

inn2.comm: wide down the off channel and that's easily left alone first up
wide again and Nazir takes an easy step back and pings that right over backward point for a flat six, lovely stuff and a great way to get off the mark
gone! Nazir was trying to drive through the off side and the thinnest of edges is enough to remove him - an easy catch for Ramdin behind the sticks. It's all going on in the first over

more runs - a four this time - as Khan manages the ball well. It got a little big on him, but he gave himself enough room to step into that cut shot and it's nearly cut off by the rope...but not quite and Khan's in the runs
huge roars from the crowd as they think Khan's edged that one through to the keeper - nearly but not quite. Dramatic stuff here
raps Khan high on the thigh with one which arcs at and away from the batsman who manages to defend it down
Taylor races in and slams that one down just outside off but the ball dies on the pitch a touch - wide enough for the batsman to leave, anyway
wide outside off again and Hafeez shapes to defend that one on the back foot, before pulling out of the shot. 'Oohs' from an exciteable crowd who are expecting a wicket every ball right now
left alone easily this time
takes the pace off that one a touch, keeping the ball in the channel
spears that one up there, on the money, and the batsman gets bat on it at last, squeezing the ball into the covers. Good pace - 90mph-plus
well bowled again, swinging that away from the batsman who shoulders arms and lets the ball fly through to Ramdin
loud cheers once more - the crowd thought Powell had his man there. A top-quality delivery packed with pace, bounce and swing. Khan did well to miss that one
defended forward this time
on the money, a forward defensive, and the ball dribbles down back towards the sticks, but pitches wide of them. The delivery was on to him quicker than he expected
worked square this time
pushed up there and it's squeezed into point - on target once more
on the money and the batsman stabs his bat down on that one which hops into the short cover region
a rare run - a leg-bye - as that one's turned off the pads just behind square
in the channel this time and that's worked into the covers for a shiny dot
pushed up there and that's sweetly driven through mid-off right along the ground. That one comes right out of the middle of the bat and that half-volley was there for the taking. He took it
stands tall and tries to whip that off his hips, but doesn't quite get hold of the ball properly and it rolls slowly into midwicket
wide and that's worked without  much power behind point for a single

gone! That delivery reared high enough to be able to leave but Khan can't resist slashing an attempted hook at it. He misses and a top edge flies through - and that's a very sunny Ramdin who snaps up the catch, his second of the innings so far
driven to cover
pushed right up there, toe crusher, but Hafeez does well to get his bat down on it
straight, with a hint of swing, and the batsman leans over his bat to defend that one
worked to midwicket where it's easily snapped up
overpitches and that's a lovely on-drive from Hafeez, standing tall and delivering, and the ball races away
straight, up there, and the batsman can only defend
short, outside off, and that's Yousuf's first ball, which he steers down off the back foot into the covers
walks forward to think about driving that one through mid-off
worked off the toes square
outside off, dies a touch on its way through to Ramdin, Yousuf leaving that one well alone
short and the batsman finds the gap through cover with a crisp drive off the back foot. The ball's hunted down inside the rope, though
angles that on to his toes - you can't bowl there to him... unless you want to have a few runs taken off you; Yousuf driving that easily in front of midwicket
full bunger but dips low and that's just driven forward without much power
driven to mid-on where it's easily picked up
aw, love it! A classic on-drive from Hafeez, perfectly timed and there's not much Powell can do in the way of fielding that one, instead he watches as it races on its merry way
nice response from Powell. That one pitches outside off, straightens and goes past the outside edge, swinging a touch as it does, and the batsman's beaten
rushes that one off his pads into midwicket - could have done better with that ball, which was too full of length
pitches on leg and that's tucked cheekily off the toes in front of midwicket. Speaking of cheeky - Yousuf steals the strike, too
defended forward
lovely touch from Yousuf, working that down off the back foot behind point for an easy single
left alone outside off
driven to cover
more good line-and-length action from Taylor and the batsman judges to leave that one
outside off, the batsman shapes to cut that away off the back foot but, seeing the ball rear more than he thought, he leaves that one alone in the end
short, just to say on leg, and that's turned away behind square for some easy run action
defended off the back foot and squirted into the cover region
left alone outside off
quick single
ooh, aah... a misdirected ball, wide, and that's a great piece of fielding by Dwayne Smith in the gully, who had to pounce low to his left after a crashing cut
another quick single to end the over and yet again Yousuf nicks the strike
worked into the short midwicket region
on the money and that's worked to mid-on
driven through mid-off and that's a poor piece of fielding by Lara - in fact it wasn't even that good, he got nowhere near it - and he allows an extra run there
defended down off the back foot
up there, a bit of an inside edge prevents the umpire thinking twice about a half-cry of Howzat
on the button and that's defended down
turned off the toes down to a very deep fine leg - ah, that'll be long leg - and that's well cut off by Taylor racing round
defended forward and there's a quick run squeezed out

gottim! Hafeez, looking to go over the top, goes instead straight to the man at mid-on with a soft catch. West Indies very much on top at this stage - but let's remember that Pakistan have the awesome Yousuf still in, and now here's Inzy to the crease, he's never easy to shift
defended forward first up
worked off the hips in front of midwicket
sways away from one which limbers invitingly up past his nose - went to play it but decided against it at the very last moment
sends that down the leg-side channel and he chases it round
up there and that jags back in from outside off and there's a big shout for lbw but Bowden shakes his head. Hawk-Eye has it hitting off
on the money in line with off and that's tucked defensively down off the back foot
worth a shout and Collymore's lips form an 'Ooh' shape as it raps him on the pad with possibly a touch of inside edge and possibly too leg-side-line-ish, too
deliberate stride forward to defend that one in front of off-stick
a stride out to meet that one outside off and that's punched in front of point
slower ball and that's deliberately defended forward
worked in front of midwicket
left alone outside off
on the money and the crowd think that's a catch at cover - it was actually a bump ball, however
oh hello, what a ball. Deceived the batsman outside his off stump, with a good length, and he went fishing for that, just missing out
more good length, matched by tidy defence on the front foot
worked towards mid-on
defended on the front foot and that rolls to cover
on the spot again and Inzamam looks to drive that straight, but eases out of the shot
worked into midwicket this time
nibbled just in front of point
defended forward this time
drives that without much power into the covers
pitches outside off, moves into the batsman, quite short, and that's worked into midwicket, pretty easily, off the hips
driven to cover
worked off the hips to mid-on without much power
attempted on-drive rolls straight to the fielder who deals with it without alarm
defended down off the back foot into the covers
on the money and defended into the on-side
straight, driven firmly into the ground and back at the bowler
the ball trickles into the leg side
Collymore right on the button to add to the pressure here
just short of a length outside off stump and Mohammad Yousuf, aims a weak waft at the ball and misses ... lots of oohs and aahs around the ground
more circumspect and solid defensive push
Yousuf forward, drives firmly to mid-on
driven to the left of Chanderpaul at mid-off and he leaps to make a superb stop, and the batsmen were briefly all at sea but both made it home
short and Inzamam on it like a shot to pull for four. Silence around the ground ...
an even better stroke, driven in a classic fashion between mid-off and extra cover for four. Lovely shot and whatever he had at the drinks interval, I want some ...
big stride forward and punched to mid-off
again hit firmly but once more he finds the fielder, this time Bravo at extra cover
Bravo into action again, picking up another punched drive
Yousuf falls over as he looks to drive that, in the end the ball goes straight back to the bowler
Yousuf being pegged back here, full on off stump and he can only block it
angled into the covers, Bravo swoops even though there was no suggestion that either batsmen was after a quick single ... well, with Inzamam there it's not really high on the agenda
worked to midwicket
at last Mohammad Yousuf breaks the shackles, driving through the covers with a shot that oozes class
angled into space to the left of point to ensure that he keeps the strike
whipped behind square on the leg side, Mohammad Yousuf thought about a second but Inzamam barely broke into a sweat running the first and he was never going to run a second
Inzamam stands tall and hammers that off the back foot just behind square on the off side
forward and defended into the off side
pushed to Lara at mid-on and Inzamam calls for the quick single as Lara misfields ... Inzamam was motoring there and ran a good 30 yards past the stumps ... once he gets going he's not easy to stop
Mohammad Yousuf plays that up to mid-on and calls for the single, no worries even thought Inzamam was back on his heels
blocked by Inzamam, a sound end to a very good spell from Powell
Yousuf gets his head right over the ball and pushes into the leg side
solid defensive stroke, pushed into the ground with an angled bat
driven firmly into the ground and on the bounce to Bravo at extra cover
slightly leg-side line, Yousuf steps to the off and flicks straight at midwicket
Collymore keeping a full length forcing Yousuf to block and not giving him much chance to play his shots
played to the right of mid-on, Yousuf ponders a single but Taylor was in quickly and Inzamam rightly opted to stay put
slightly short, Inzamam shapes to pull but mistimes it and bottom-edges it into his midriff without any sign of distress
solid block, almost with exaggerated caution
blocked on off stump. The rate is now over six for the first time
Inzamam meets another straight one with a dead bat
driven with an open face between cover and extra cover to the man patrolling in the deep
flicked off his hips to deep backward square leg
good line and length, defensive shot
angled with an open face to wide third man
driven a tad uppishly, quite safe though, to wide third man
driven past the bowler to deepish mid-off, always a single there
well placed, almost effortlessly, between mid-on and midwicket, barely any force as he flicked it on the leg side
inside edge onto pads down to long leg
slashed down to third man
Inzamam shuffles across to the off side, so far that he ends up having to pad it as he can't get his bat round his front leg
cracked to mid-on who makes a good stop. Inzamam looks scornfully at his bat as if it and not he was to blame for not finding the gap
into space on the leg side this time
Yousuf waits and works into the leg side, dropping it into space
pushed to cover, only three off the over
crisp drive into the covers
one step and swatted off middle stump over midwicket and to the rope. So easy, so effortless ...
angled drive right to cover
no run again, he once more finds the fielder
Inzamam looks to cut but plays over the ball
hit uppishly down to long leg, no chance of a catch but not really controlled
Inzamam back and punched into the off side
pushed into the covers
driven into the covers and Bravo makes a tumbling one-handed stop to scotch any sniff of a single
not even the athletic Bravo can stop this one as Inzamam adjusts his angles
Yousuf walks to the off and works into the leg-side field
Inzamam looks cheesed off as he fails to find a gap. He leans on his bat and visibly huffs as he shakes his head
loosener driven through the covers to the sweeper
Inzamam back, thumps the ball to long-on and chugs the single
driven off his toes right to midwicket who is in quickly to prevent a single
once more Yousuf shuffles across his stumps and flicks to midwicket
worked to the man deep at square leg
turned down to long leg where Powell fields
punched up to long-on
open face down to third man, controlled
again angled to third man to bring up the 50 stand off 96 balls
played into the off side
firm drive under the diving Lara at extra cover and Taylor round from long-off to mop up
open face down to third man. Six runs off the over with almost no effort
crisp off drive but only one as there is a man in the deep. There might have been two had there been a different pair at the crease
square drive and this time Samuels has to make 20 yards to his left to make a tumbling stop on the cover boundary. How on earth did they manage to just one run there?
square drive, Inzamam wanted the second but Yousuf was having none of it and he sent his captain back
turned behind square on the leg side
into the covers, never a single
placed down to third man
worked up to long-on, ambled single, ambled fielding, all very subdued as is often the case in the middle stages of a one-day innings
square drive well fielded at backward point by a leaping Bravo
this time Inzamam finds space
Yousuf takes a step down the track and across to the off, shaping to flick to the leg  side, and is almost bowled rounds his legs
again the crowd roar their approval as Yousuf makes things hard for himself outside the off stump

Yousuf goes to Smith's obvious delight. A little short, the ball climbed on him and seamed back in, cramping him for room and an outside edge spat through to Ramdin to give him his third catch of the innings. Pakistan were cruising ... now they have work to do
leg side, but right at a fielder
up to long-on for an ambled single, all very gentle
full length, firmly driven to mid-off who fumbles but still prevents the run
wide of off stump, spanked to the backward-point boundary just evading the man on the rope
one step and driven right back at Bravo who misfields and then throws his hands to his head ... had he picked that up cleanly then the batsman was stranded two yards down the track
Shoaib chops down on the ball and runs it to third man
worked to the covers
worked again into the cover
defended forward
turned off the toes behind square
helped through midwicket and there's not much rush in the running, there
strays down leg, the batsman comes forward and works that out to long-on
outside off and that's worked off the back foot down behind point
cuts in off the seam and that's worked into the cover
short and that's worked off the back foot to cover
wide and Malik flashes at that one, silly really to chase that, and it goes over the top edge
quick single into the covers
straight, up there, but that's worked into the covers
shot! Moves back to give himself room and then steps elegantly into that aerial extra-cover drive which nearly carries for a clean six. It's a clean four instead
improvised pull shot tucked off the hips and swivelled to midwicket
right up there and that's nudged down quietly into the covers

inducker and that's as plumb as you like - and Smith certainly does like - whooping as Taufel raises the finger. Hawk-Eye suggests that the ball may have been going over, but Inzamam is on his way and this could be the turning point
...no he can't because he's gone! Akmal slashed low to gully and that's a fantastic catch. Smith on a hat-trick now, no pressure then for Naved
driven easily to cover, brushing off the pressure like swatting a fly
driven to long-on
ooh, excellent slower delivery - too good in fact, spitting off a length, bouncing, dipping - the batsman fished at that a long way away from his body, but missed it. Top bowling
quicker one, on a length, and that's defended stoutly on the front foot
launches into a strong flat-batted cut in front of the body and that's laced through cover
straighter, and that's nibbled into the off-side
another slower ball, clever, and the batsman visibly adjusts his thinking, dropping his bat on it at the last minute
driven to long-off and there's an easy single
ooh - the batsman takes a risk there, and it pays off this time - lifting a wide one up in the air off the toe-end of the bat, and it bounces just short of deep third man
worked into the leg side
driven to cover
turned off the hips behind square
pitches outside off and that's worked to just inside the boundary where the sweeper does what his job description is, and sweeps that one up
a single to mid-on this time
a huge appeal but it sounded like there was a life-saving smidgen of inside edge on that one - ah, yes there was - and the umpire rightly turns the call down
a bit more convincing from Naved this time - just a bit, mind - getting the face of the bat on that and driving it without much power to the covers
oh, nearly a run out there by Bravo, who was quickly on to that one. The batsman popped the ball into space on the leg-side, the bowler turned and shied to the non-striker's end
ooh, nearly the edge - wafting. A wicket's in the air, here, you expect one every ball right now
pressure released a tad with that last ball, on leg, and worked away down to fine leg. But the momentum - and the money - is still more than with West Indies
pitches outside off but the batsman tries to drive it in fact to mid-on - he doesn't get hold of the shot whatsoever, though
oh, cracker of a delivery, tempting the batsman to push at that one - with a shot shaping towards cover - on the front foot, but he missed it, just to say
defended this time
a big appeal for lbw - it must have been close but Umpire Taufel is not interested. Replays indicate height was a factor, and perhaps it pitched outside the line, too
defended once more
turned off the legs in front of square
that shot will do nothing to help the mood - it's one of desperation; a flat heave aiming towards mid-off, but not getting hold of it at all
nearly has his man this time, with a drive that takes the inside edge and crashes straight into the foot. Ouch
good bowling, taking the pace off it and that's just to say hit into the covers
banged in but the ball doesn't get up off the pitch and that's driven to cover
on the money, but the batsman manages to straight-drive it to mid-off where it's picked up without a fuss
on the button and that's a lovely defensive shot
rushed out off his toes to the man on the midwicket boundary
comes down the track looking to launch into a forceful on-drive, but the length is better than he expected and he ends up checking the shot
worked that down to a short fine leg and that's a quick single
pushed up there and the batsman can only defend this time
driven off the toes to cover
just short of a good length and that's driven to cover
another shot born of desperation - walking back to a straight, short one and trying to flat-bat it into the covers with a cut shot. It doesn't go anywhere of purpose
that's better, but nearly results in a run-out as Taylor just to say misses the striker's stumps as Pakistan take a very risky single
good stuff! A very clean strike and that's a one-bounce four to the midwicket boundary
on leg stump, and that's taken off the toes and worked very well down to deep backward square leg
in the blockhole and the batsman does well to get some bat on it, driving it out without much power to the cover region
up there and that's driven back to the bowler
full, driven to mid-on

Bravo cleans up Rana Naved-ul-Hasan, completing a miserable day for the Pakistan allrounder. Pitched up, Naved-ul-Hasan swung across the line, got a thick inside edge and dragged the ball into his stumps.  Bravo wheeled away in celebration as the batsman skulked off
straight and Iftikhar digs it out
slower ball - 65mph - and Iftikhar pats it back to the bowler

speared in at Iftikhar's feet, it cannoned into the off side off his foot and Bravo sprinted to field as Iftikhar started off for a single and he had to scurry back as Bravo shaped to throw down the stumps
another one right up in the blockhole which Iftikhar can do no more than keep out
driven on the half volley to mid-on
angled down the leg side, flicked to deep square leg

comedy running - a yorker dug out into the off side, Shoaib started running, Iftikhar  stayed put and then set off just as Shoaib started back. In the end Sarwan, running in from cover, just had to hit from 10 yards but missed by an inch
in the slot, heaved over cow corner for a big six. That went over the rope and more
prodded into the leg side
banged in, that got big on Iftikhar who was struck a painful blow on the collar bone  and made no attempt to hide the fact that it hurt as he staggered away
two steps down the track and slammed back over the bowler for a one bounce four. Can he pull this out of the fire? It would be a remarkable start to the tournament if he could ...
slower ball - 68mph - which Shoaib tried to steer to third man and ended up on his knees giving the bowler a rueful smile

brilliant one-handed stop a yard in from the rope as Shoaib slammed the ball to the long-on boundary. A replay showed that Gayle clipped the rope with his back foot as he regained his balance and the third umpire signals the four
half volley absolutely hammered to long-off on the bounce
a full toss speared down the leg side and Iftikhar, who had stepped to the off, missed
another full toss, pulled to the square-leg boundary
up in the blockhole, well dug out to mid-off
swung to the leg side to bring up Shoaib's 21st ODI fifty
bouncer which Iftikhar ducks and then, off balance, he totters away on his haunches towards square leg
short, pulled but not remotely timed to deep square leg
a rather ungainly heave into the leg side
half volley on off stump driven up to long-on. It's now two a ball and this game seems done and dusted
full, chipped back over Taylor and mid-on and mid-off converge to limit it to a single
full on leg stump, cracked to wide long-on
firm drive to Powell at long-off
full, driven past Bravo who throws down a left hand but misses, and mid-off quickly in to prevent the single
Iftikhar squirts it out into the off side
heaved from outside off stump into the leg side, high but safe and just the single
slashed over cover, good running means that they come back for the second and a high throw adds to the ease of the second run
heaved towards long-off but it falls just short of the man there
chipped to deep midwicket. An ambled single shows that the batsmen know the game is up as well
driven to extra cover where Sarwan makes a tumbling stop
into the covers, Lara happy to give a run a ball as the rate heads northwards
he won't be so happy about that as Collymore drifts to the leg side and Shoaib helps it on its way
worked wide of midwicket for a single
Shoaib forced to do a fast-shoe shuffle by a yorker speared in at his feet
up to long-on as the crowd get ready to party
slow by slower ball standards - 57mph which is shy of Monty Panesar speed - and driven backward of point
athletic stop diving to his right by Bravo, changing direction in his follow through
Iftikhar chips a full toss from a slower delivery to Lara at extra cover where he takes the catch high above his head

you won't see many better catches than that! A full toss driven firmly back to the left of Bravo who stuck out a hand and held the ball at full stretch no more than 18 inches above the ground in his follow through. A jubilant Bravo sprints into the deep pursued by team-mates ...
driven into the deep but Shoaib turns down the single. Not sure what the point is at this stage

Shoaib steps back and looks to send the ball into the harbour but gets under it and Chanderpaul coming in from long-off takes the steepler. He is mobbed by delighted fielders and unlike 2003, when West Indies proved to be party poopers, the hosts have won the opening match
